resources.string: All it takes is steady practice.
You can live in paradise. All it takes is steady practice.

string-array.name: section_1_para_1
string-array.item: Copyright 2017 © Roach City Software.
This software is licensed under the Eclipse Public License 1.0.

string-array.name: section_1_para_2
string-array.item: You can train your mind to focus more on the good things of the world.
It\'s a matter of practicing thinking about good things, and feeling happy about them.
As with any kind of training, steady practice is key.

string-array.name: section_1_para_3
string-array.item: This app helps you train.
You start by building a list of good things,
and then use that list to practice thinking about good things.

string-array.name: section_1_para_4
string-array.item: After a week of regular, daily practice, you will find yourself starting
to sometimes feel really good for no particular reason. Keep on training,
and this will happen more and more often, and more strongly. Sometimes,
the world will just light up with beauty. After a
month of steady practice, you will feel very happy most of the time.

string-array.name: section_1_para_5
string-array.item: Steady practice is the golden key to paradise.

string-array.name: section_2_para_1
string-array.item: Before you can practice, you need a list of good things.
Use the Build List screen to create that list.
Enter things that make you happy into the text
box, and press the Add button after each one.

string-array.name: section_2_para_2
string-array.item: For example, let\'s say you like hotdogs. Enter \"hotdogs\" in the text box –
all you need is the one word. Notice that the example is hotdogs - probably not
the greatest thing you\'ve ever eaten, but good. You need a lot of things that make
you happy for your list – but they don\'t all have to be wonderful. Just good is
good enough.

string-array.name: section_2_para_3
string-array.item: You will need lots of things that make you happy in your list - and lots of
different kinds of things. Food, pets, friends, things you are proud of, natural
beauty, special moments in your life, music, movies, books, sex, big and little
victories, insights, escapes from danger and relief from pain - anything and
everything you can feel good about. Humor (favorite jokes, funny happenings) is
especially good.

string-array.name: section_2_para_4
string-array.item: If you need help thinking of different kinds of good things, use
the Hints button.

string-array.name: section_2_para_5
string-array.item: Once you\'ve made a good start on your list, you can begin training. However,
that shouldn\'t stop you from adding to your list. Keep growing the list as long as
you keep practicing.

string-array.name: section_3_para_1
string-array.item: Use the Practice screen for daily practice. The screen will show one item from
your list, and a Next button.

string-array.name: section_3_para_2
string-array.item: Think about what\'s good about the item on the screen – why you like it.
When you feel as good about the item as you can, press the Next button.
Keep going. At the end of the session, the Next button will say Done
and the Practice screen will close when you press it.

string-array.name: section_3_para_3
string-array.item: The idea is to use each item to make yourself feel good. If the item is \"hotdogs\",
and you find yourself remembering a fair where you had a hotdog and how much fun the
Ferris wheel was, that\'s great - you\'re feeling happy. If you find yourself
thinking \"I really wish I had a hotdog right now!\", that\'s not great - you\'re not
feeling happy. If you find yourself thinking \"Gee, I feel really stupid thinking
about hotdogs!\", that\'s not great either.

string-array.name: section_3_para_4
string-array.item: If you get distracted by some of these not so great thoughts, don\'t try to fight it.
Instead, just try to remember what\'s good about your happy list item. Struggling
against bad thoughts just makes them stronger. Actively concentrating on good thoughts
will lead to the bad thoughts fading away on their own.

string-array.name: section_3_para_5
string-array.item: Items on the Practice screen can be edited, if you really think you need to. They can
also be deleted, if they don’t work anymore. Just edit or delete the text and press
the Next button.

string-array.name: section_3_para_6
string-array.item: Practice every day to feel really great!

resources.string: Build a list of good things first - then practice.
Tap item to edit (or delete) if needed.

string-array.name: praise_list
string-array.item: Way to go!
Excellent!
Very good!
Congratulations!
Good job!

resources.string: Maximum items added in one session:
This world can be both heaven and hell. It\'s hell when your mind is filled with bad things - problems, failures, loss and pain. It\'s heaven when your mind is filled with good things.

You can train your mind to focus more on the good things. Practice thinking about good things, and feeling happy about them. This app helps you train. Start by building a list of good things – at least 50 items (to start with). Use that list to practice felling happy about good things – in 15 minute sessions once a day. As with any kind of training, steady practice is key.

After a week of regular, daily practice, you will sometimes feel really good for no particular reason. Keep on training, and this will happen more and more. After a month of steady practice, you will feel very happy most of the time. Steady practice is the golden key to paradise.
